options.name: Beginner Evoker
options.description: You can research Beginner Level Evocation Spells and gain +1 Power.

options.name: Free Action : Elemental Charge
options.description: You charge an Evocation Spell with a Subschool using one Power. Until your next Full Rest, you are not able to Channel Spells from other Evocation Subschools.

options.name: Reaction : Absorb Energy
options.description: In response to taking Elemental Damage, you empower your Conduit. The next Evocation Spell you Channel before the end of your next turn is automatically Charged and takes 2 less Power.

options.name: Novice Evoker
options.description: You can research Novice Level Evocation Spells, gain +1 Spell Attack and +2 Power.

options.name: Free Action : Elemental Weapon
options.description: When you deal Elemental Damage using an Evocation Spell, you can make an Attack with a Light or Ultra-Light Weapon. If you hit your Target, the Primary Damage on the weapon is converted to the same type of Damage as your Channeled Spell.

options.name: Destructive Evocation
options.description: Your Evocation Spells Critically Hit when you roll a True Hit

options.name: Journeyman Evoker
options.description: You can research Journeyman Level Evocation Spells, gain +5 Power and +1 Elemental Mitigation

options.name: Free Action : Expanded Spell
options.description: When you Channel an Evocation Spell, increase the Radius of an Area Spell or the Width of a Line Spell by 1 Unit.

options.name: Expert Evoker
options.description: You can research Expert Level Evocation Spells, gain +8 Power, +1 Spell Attack and +1 Spell Damage

options.name: Reaction : Seeker
options.description: As a Reaction, you can mark a Target. Until the end of your next turn, that Target does not benefit from Partial or Full Cover against your Projectile Spells and your Projectile Spells against that target have +10 Units of Extra Range. Any requirements for needing to see your Target are removed.

options.name: Action [Daily] : Arcane Cataclysm
options.description: You make an Area Spell Attack with your Focus that is centered on your location with a Radius of 3 Units. Spend up to your Level in Focus Points, dealing 1d6 Arcane Damage for each point spent.

options.name: Master Evoker
options.description: You can research Master Level Evocation Spells, gain +10 Power, +1 Spell Attack and +1 Resistance. Additionally, you can research or learn Grand Master Evocation Spells at level 13.
